'''Bandit Keith''' is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. This is a video game incarnation of [[Keith Howard (manga)|Bandit Keith]] from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]].

== Biography ==
Keith takes part in the [[KaibaCorp|Kaiba Corporation]] World Championship tournament and faces [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]] in the fourth round.

== Dialogue ==
{{Bandit Keith pages}}
{{Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories characters}}

{{Infobox character

| unnamed             = true
| gender              = Male

The '''card shop owner''' is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]'' appearing in the card shop in Ancient Egypt.

When the player enters the card shop, the owner gives the player the option to:
* '''Build Deck'''
* '''Save Game'''
* '''Return to title Screen'''.

When [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]] returns to Ancient Egypt after [[the Mages]] have taken over, the Dueling Grounds and Card Shop relocate at the Hiding Card Shop. Here he gives the player the option to go to the card shop or Dueling Grounds.

The '''Desert Mage''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''.

== Biography ==
The Desert Mage was located at the [[Desert Shrine]]. The [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] defeated him in order to proceedi to [[High Mage Martis]], to Duel for the [[Millennium Scale]].

'''Duel Master K''' (デュエルマスターＫ ''Dyueru Masutā Kei'') is the sponsor of the Free Duel mode in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. He is available only in Free Duel and uses the same Deck as the player.

== Deck ==
Duel Master K uses the same Deck as the player.

In the game's ROM, he has a placeholder Deck, which he does not use in normal gameplay. It is a copy of [[Simon Muran (FMR)|Simon Muran]]'s Deck.

The '''Forest Mage''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''.

== Biography ==
The Forest Mage is located at the [[Forest Shrine]]. The [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] must defeat him before proceeding to [[High Mage Anubisius]] to Duel for the [[Millennium Key (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Key]].

== Dialogue ==
{{Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories characters}}

{{About|the ''Forbidden Memories'' character|appearances in other games|the "[[#Other appearances|other appearances]]" section}}
{{Infobox character

| en_name       = Heishin
| ja_name       = ヘイシーン
| romaji_name   = Heishīn
| fr_name       = Heishin
| de_name       =

}}

'''Heishin''' is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. He is the High Mage of the Amenhotep Dynasty. He is portrayed as an elderly yet megalomaniacal man set on acquiring the [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Items]] to gain a great power.

Although he makes no appearance in the anime or manga, Heishin has played a prominent role in a number of video games based on the Yu-Gi-Oh! series, often acting as the main antagonist in the initial stages of the game to be killed off and later replaced by a much more powerful villain. Though his role generally differs from one game to the next and is power level is only significant in Forbidden Memories, his ambitions of grabbing power and glory remain the same.

== Biography ==
Heishin managed to steal six of the seven [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Items]]. Using this new found power, he invaded the palace and attacked [[Simon Muran (FMR)|Simon Muran]] with the [[Millennium Rod (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Rod]], while searching for the [[Millennium Puzzle (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Puzzle]]. However Simon slipped the puzzle to [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]], encouraging him to take it and flee from the palace. Heishin stopped the prince and defeated him in a Duel (if the prince managed to win, Heishin would repeatedly challenge him until he lost). Heishin attempted to claim the Millennium Puzzle, but he was held back by Simon who convinced the prince to break it, resulting in the souls of the prince and Simon being sealed inside it for thousands of years.

During the prince's absence, Heishin and the mages gained control of the metropolis and governed the land as they wished with no one to oppose them. After the prince returned and defeated the mages who guarded the Millennium Items, Heishin was betrayed by [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]], who led the prince to him. Heishin Dueled the prince and was ultimately defeated. However he secretly followed Seto and the prince to the [[Forbidden Ruins]]. As the ritual to summon [[DarkNite]] began, he held a dagger to Seto's throat claiming that he was aware of his treachery from the very beginning, but played along. Seto, being a descendant of a dark clan, whose membership was necessary to perform the ritual, made him a necessity in Heishin's goal. Threatening to kill Seto, Heishin convinced the prince to hand over the Millennium Items. With the seven totems gathered, he used them in the dark ceremony to call forth DarkNite.

[[File:HeishinVG-FMR.png|thumb|left|Heishin turned into a card, by DarkNite]]
Heishin attempted to command DarkNite as per the pact, but DarkNite claimed no allegiance to Heishin and turned him into a [[Heishin (card)|card]]. Claiming the card to be one of the noisiest and ugliest cards he ever created, DarkNite said it did not deserve a place in his Deck and burned it.

{{clear}}

== Deck ==
Heishin's Deck contained many powerful cards, including "[[Perfectly Ultimate Great Moth (FMR)|Perfectly Ultimate Great Moth]]" and "[[B. Skull Dragon (FMR)|B. Skull Dragon]]". The second time the prince faced him, he included "[[Blue-eyes White Dragon (FMR)|Blue-eyes White Dragon]]" and "[[Gate Guardian (FMR)|Gate Guardian]]" in his Deck.

'''High Mage Anubisius''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. He is the only High Mage, who does not appear in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom]]''.

== Biography ==
Anubisius is located at the [[Forest Shrine]]. The [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] faces him after defeating the [[Forest Mage]]. The Prince duels and defeats him, taking the [[Millennium Key (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Key]].

== Deck ==
Anubisius plays a [[Forest (terrain)|Forest]] Deck. Many of cards benefit from the Forest field, including "[[Great Moth]]" and "[[Perfectly Ultimate Great Moth]]", powered to 3100 and 4000 [[ATK]] from the field.

'''High Mage Atenza''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. In ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom]]'', he appears as an enemy Marshal, named [[Atensa]].

== Biography ==
Atenza is located at the [[Mountain Shrine]]. The [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] faced him after defeating the [[Mountain Mage]]. The prince defeated him and took the [[Millennium Ring (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Ring]].

'''High Mage Secmeton''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. In ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom]]'', he appears as an enemy Marshal, named [[Secmayton]].

== Biography ==
Secmeton is located at the [[Sea Shrine]]. The [[prince (FMR)|prince]] faces him after defeating the [[Ocean Mage]]. The prince Duels and defeats him, taking the [[Millennium Necklace (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Necklace]].

'''Isis''', known as '''Naomi Ishizu''' (石津ナオミ ''Ishizu Naomi'') in the Japanese version, is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. She is the game's incarnation of [[Ishizu Ishtar (manga)|Ishizu Ishtar]] from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]]. The game was developed before her manga appearance and released just two months before her manga debut. Consequently, she has contrasting personalities in the two mediums, having a more fierce personality in the video game.

Isis appears as one of the contenders in the Duel Monsters World Championship. After she lost to [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]], her [[Millennium Necklace (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Necklace]] got absorbed into 1 of the [[Millennium Item Card]]s.

== Deck ==
Isis uses mainly [[WATER]] monsters. Her strongest cards are "[[B. Skull Dragon (FMR)|B. Skull Dragon]]" and "[[Twin-headed Thunder Dragon (FMR)|Twin-headed Thunder Dragon]]".

'''Jono''' is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. He is the ancient Egyptian counterpart of [[Joey Wheeler (FMR)|Joey Wheeler]]. He is friends with [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]]. Although he is initially unaware of his royal status.

== Biography ==
[[File:Seto defeats Jono.png|thumb|left|300px|Jono loses to [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]].]]
Jono is first seen dueling and losing to the mage [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] where he is greeted by [[Teana]] and the Prince, just before he is defeated. The mage mocks Jono's dueling skills but Jono and Teana tell him that the Prince could easily defeat him. Seto is however summoned and cannot duel the Prince. Jono, Teana and the Prince return to the Dueling Grounds where he loses to the Prince in a friendly duel.

Jono is not seen again until [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]] returns the Prince to the past. Upon the prince's return Jono briefs him on the political situation of the Dynasty and how the Mages, led by Heishin govern the land. He leads the Prince to the Hidden Dueling Grounds where he plays him in another friendly duel.

After the Prince defeats the High Mages Jono informs him that Teana has been kidnapped by Seto. The Prince and Jono head to the Dark Shrine where they defeat a Labyrinth Mage (or multiple depending on how the player navigates). After passing the Labyrinth, they find Seto and Heishin with some aides, holding down Teana. Seto releases Teana saying and offers the prince a chance to duel Heishin. Teana thanks Jono and the Prince for the rescue and they travel back to the Hidden Dueling Grounds. Jono tells the Prince to be cautious as they part ways.

== Deck ==
Jono's Deck is based on the Deck used by [[Katsuya Jonouchi (manga)|Katsuya Jonouchi]]'s in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|manga]], during [[Duelist Kingdom (manga)|Duelist Kingdom]]. The first time the player faces him, he uses mainly [[Warrior]] and [[Beast-Warrior]] cards.  The second time the player faces him, a significant change to his Deck is the inclusion of "[[Red-eyes B. Dragon (FMR)|Red-eyes B. Dragon]]".

The '''Labyrinth Mage''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. In ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Duelists of the Roses]]'', he also appears as a character named [[Labyrinth Ruler]].

== Biography ==
The Labyrinth Mage confronts the [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] and [[Jono]], when they go to the [[Vast Shrine]], to rescue [[Teana]], who had been kidnapped by [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]].

The player may have to face the Labyrinth Mage multiple times, depending on how they navigate through the Labyrinth. To only have to face him once the player should go, right, right, left, right.

== Dialogue ==

== Trivia ==
* Labyrinth Mage is the ancient Egyptian counterpart of the [[Para|Paradox]] [[Dox|Brothers]], as his Deck contains the same monsters they used in their Duel with [[Yami Yugi]] and [[Joey Wheeler|Joey]], including [[Gate Guardian]] and [[Sanga of the Thunder|the]] [[Suijin|three]] [[Kazejin|monsters]] required to summon it.

{{Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories characters}}

| organization  = [[The Mages]]
| deck          = 
| defaultsort   = false
}}

The '''Mage Soldier''' is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. The ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom]]'' incarnation of Mage Soldiers are called [[Officer (TFK)|Officers]].

== Biography ==
A Mage Soldier Duels [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]], when he finds him at the remains of the palace, while the Mages are in control of the metropolis. After losing, he admits to underestimating the prince.

Another Mage Soldier guards the Vast Shrine, preventing the prince to Heishin's temple.

'''Mai Valentine''', known as '''Mai Kujaku''' in the Japanese version, is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. This is a video incarnation of [[Mai Kujaku (manga)|Mai Kujaku]] from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]].

== Biography ==
Mai takes part in the [[KaibaCorp|Kaiba Corporation]] World Championship tournament and faces [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]] in the third round.

'''Nitemare''', known as '''Card Majin''' (カード魔神 ''Kādo Majin'', lit. "Card Devil") in the Japanese version, is the main antagonist in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. He initially appears in his less powerful form, '''DarkNite'''. In the Japanese versions, DarkNite is referred to as "Card Majin", while Nitemare is referred to as "Card Majin (true form)". A majin is a malevolent deity that causes misfortune and disaster.

He is mentioned in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Duelists of the Roses]]'' by his brother, [[Manawyddan fab Llyr]].

== Biography ==
[[File:DarkNite-FMR.png|thumb|left|257px|Nitemare in his DarkNite form]]
Nitemare was sealed away in the [[Forbidden Ruins]], only to be awoken when the 7 [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Items]] are brought there.

When [[Heishin]] awakens DarkNite, he attempts to order him claiming it is part of the pact, but DarkNite says that he does not recall making a pact with Heishin. When Heishin begins to plea with DarkNite, he quickly grows tired of the conversation and turns Heishin into a [[Heishin (card)|card]]. Finding it to be the noisiest and ugliest he ever created, DarkNite burns it saying it does not deserve a place in his Deck.

DarkNite then turns to [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]] and [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] saying that they would make nice additions to his Deck. Seto reminds the prince about the [[Millennium Item Card]]s. The prince then holds out the cards forcing DarkNite back. Unable to fully hold him back, the prince is left to duel DarkNite. After losing once DarkNite refuses to accept his defeat and turns into Nitemare demanding another Duel. The prince proceeds to defeat Nitemare, sending him back to where he came from.

The '''Ocean Mage''' is one of the Mages in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''.

== Biography ==
The Ocean Mage is located at the [[Sea Shrine]]. The [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] must defeat him before proceeding to [[High Mage Secmeton]] to Duel for the [[Millennium Necklace (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Necklace]].

(manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]]. True to the manga, he knows the strength of [[face-down]] monsters via his [[Millennium Eye (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Eye]]

The '''prince''' is the player character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. His name is chosen by the player. He is referred to as '''The Hero''' in the instruction manual. While, he resided in [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]]'s body, he was referred to as '''Yami''', by [[Shadi (FMR)|Shadi]]. This is a video game depiction of [[Pharaoh Atem]], a character from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]] and [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (anime)|anime]]. He is a silent protagonist, with the exception of one scene in the game.

== Biography ==
[[File:Prince-FMR-ConceptArt.png|thumb|left|250|Full profile of the prince]]
The prince often snuck out of the palace to spend time at the Dueling Grounds, with the villagers, particularly [[Teana]] and [[Jono]], who were unaware of his royalty. After returning to the palace one night, he found the mage, [[Heishin|Heishin]], now in possession of the [[Millennium Rod (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Rod]], had attacked the palace and demanded the [[Millennium Puzzle (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Puzzle]]. The prince's attendant, [[Simon Muran (FMR)|Simon Muran]], gave the prince the Puzzle and told him to run. He could not escape and was confronted by Heishin, who demanded the Puzzle. The prince Dueled him in an attempt to escape. After losing, Simon convinced the prince to shatter the Puzzle.

After shattering the puzzle, Simon sealed the prince and his spirit inside it. He remained there, asleep for millennia, until [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]] entered a ''Duel Monsters'' competition, hosted by [[Kaiba (FMR)|Kaiba]]. [[Shadi (FMR)|Shadi]], holder of the [[Millennium Key (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Key]] and [[Millennium Scales (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Scales]] appeared and said that he came because of Yugi's [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Item]]. He used the Key to open Yugi's mind, where he could meet the prince. The prince gave Yugi [[Millennium Item Card|six cards]] and although he did not speak, Yugi understood what he wanted of him. Yugi defeated all the present day holders of the [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Items]] in the tournament, each time sealing their Item in one of the cards. Using the six cards, Yugi was able to send the prince home.

When the prince arrived home, the mages had taken over the area. He headed to the [[King's Valley (Forbidden Memories)|King's Valley]], in search of the Forbidden Ruins. Here he met [[Sadin]], who recognized him as Prince, but did not know the location of the Forbidden Ruins. So the prince returned to the palace, which was in ruins. After confronting and defeating a [[Mage Soldier]] there, the prince found a map to the Forbidden Ruins. The prince returned to the King's Valley, where Sadin escorted him to the ruins. There he found a map and met [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]], who informed him the map showed the location of where Heishin had hidden the Items, and told him of his plans to betray Heishin.

After defeating two of the high mages, the prince met Jono, who told him that the mages had kidnapped Teana and led him to the Dark Shrine. After passing through the labyrinth, facing [[Labyrinth Mage]]s, at wrong turns, they found Teana held hostage by Seto and Heishin. Heishin ordered Seto to defeat the prince and take the Millennium Puzzle. The prince defeated Seto, but was confused when Seto applauded him and said that the High Mages did not stand a chance. Teana was released and she, the prince and Jono left.

The prince proceeded to defeat the High Mages and acquire all Millennium Items bar the [[Millennium Rod (Forbidden Memories)|Rod]], which was held by Seto. After doing so he met Seto, who told him to go to the Dark Shrine, where he would lead him to Heishin. There, the prince defeated the Guardians [[Sebek]] and [[Neku]], before finding and defeating Heishin.

After Heishin's defeat, Seto took the prince to the Forbidden Ruins, where he explained that he used him to gather all the Items. He told him how the Millennium Items could be used to summon a great power. As Seto is about to claim that power, Heishin appeared and put a knife to Seto's neck, demanding the Items. Atem handed them over the items, which Heishin used to Summon [[DarkNite]]. DarkNite refused to obey Heishin and turns him into a card, which he incinerated. Using the Millennium Item cards, the prince held back DarkNite and faced him it a Duel, to send him back where he came from. When the prince won, DarkNite turned into Nitemare and demanded a final Duel. The prince played on and defeated Nitemare.

Afterwards, the prince ruled Egypt as the Pharaoh, and had the [[Forbidden Ruins]] buried in order to protect mankind.

'''Sadin''' is an ancient Egyptian counterpart of [[Shadi]] in the video game, ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''.

==Biography==
Sadin meets [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]] in the King's Valley. The prince asked Sadin if he can show him the way to the Forbidden Ruins, but Sadin did not know the way.

Later after the prince acquires a map and returns to the valley, Sadin takes the map and directs him to the Forbidden Ruins, where Sadin points out a map and drawing on opposite walls. After viewing the drawing and ascertaining nothing, the prince looks at the Map while [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] sneaks up behind them and tells them that the Map reveals the location of [[The Mages#High Mages|the High Mages]] and the [[Millennium Items]]. After Seto urges Atem to defeat the High Mages, Sadin yells at him to leave and advises Atem to proceed with caution, since Seto is an enemy and any positive action on Seto's part could be equally dangerous.

Sebek is one of [[Heishin]]'s guardians, along with [[Neku]]. He is defeated by the [[Prince (FMR)|prince]], after [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] leads the prince to Heishin.

The '''servant''' is an unnamed character appearing in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. She is named [[Fizdis]] in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom]]''.

==Biography==
[[File:Servant captured.png|thumb|left|300px|[[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] takes the servant captive.]]
The servant worked in the palace of the Amenhotep dynasty.

When the palace was under attack, she hurriedly woke [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]], informed him of [[Heishin]]'s invasion and urged that they escape. However, she was captured by [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] and two other [[The Mages|Mages]]. Seto ordered them to take her away, while he spoke with the prince. She pleaded for help, but was taken away.

{{Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories characters}}

| appears_in_ps = ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''
| gender        = Male
| organization  = [[The Mages]]
| deck          = [[Blue-Eyes]]
}}

'''Seto''' in is the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]'' incarnation of [[Seto (manga)|Seto]]. He is portrayed more as an antagonist, than his manga and anime counterparts. Seto is the high mage [[Heishin]]'s right-hand man and rival to [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]].

==Biography==
[[File:SetoAppears-FMR.png|thumb|left|200px|Seto appears at the Duel ground.]]
While visiting the [[Town plaza]], [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]] finds [[Jono]] dueling against Seto. Seto wins and proceeds to mock Jono, but he claimed that Seto is not good enough to defeat one of his friends, unaware that his friend was secretly the prince of Egypt. Seto proceeds to challenge the prince but is then called by Heishin, he postpones the Duel and tells him to wait at the [[Duel ground (FMR)|Duel ground]]. When he appears at the Duel ground, he proceeds to duel and is promptly defeated by the prince, he leaves the grounds but he has found out who the prince really was.

After [[the Mages]] takes over Egypt, Seto finds the prince at the [[Forbidden Ruins]]. He explains the meaning of the map the prince had found. It revealed the location of each [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Item]]. He challenges the prince to defeat the High Mage at each of the shrines on the map. Although [[Sadin]] advises the prince not to trust Seto, he complies with Seto's instructions.

After the prince defeats one of the High Mages, Seto and the mages has kidnapped [[Teana]] and held her hostage to draw the prince to him. When the prince and Jono arrived at the [[Vast Shrine]] to rescue her, Heishin ordered Seto to defeat the prince and take the [[Millennium Puzzle (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Puzzle]]. Seto releases Teana and he duels the prince. Seto is defeated, but gloats about how the Mages do not stand a chance against the prince and lets them go.

[[File:ForbiddenChamberEntance-FMR.png|thumb|left|200px|Seto explaining his family's history.]]
After the prince defeats the remaining High Mages and retrieves their Millennium Items, Seto approaches him and tells him to go to the now unguarded [[Dark Shrine]], where he could face Heishin. Seto shows him the way to Heishin. After the prince defeats Heishin, Seto takes the [[Millennium Rod (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Rod]] and goes with the prince to the [[Forbidden Ruins]], where he revealed his true plan. He had planned the prince to defeat all the high mages and gather all the Millennium Items for him. Seto explain his family's dark history and how they made a pact with a being known as [[DarkNite]], he plans to acquire great power, by summoning DarkNite, but Heishin appears and holds a knife to Seto's neck demanding the prince to give him the Millennium Items, under the threat of taking Seto's life. The prince gives Heishin the Items, which Heishin uses to summon DarkNite.

After the prince defeats DarkNite, Seto disappears and is never heard from again.

==Deck==
The first time [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]] faces Seto, his Deck contains many strong cards for such an early stage in the game, including "[[Gaia the Fierce Knight (FMR)|Gaia the Fierce Knight]]". The second time he is faced, he uses "[[Gate Guardian (FMR)|Gate Guardian]]" and "[[Blue-eyes White Dragon (FMR)|Blue-eyes White Dragon]]". The third time faced, Seto uses many powerful cards, with up to three copies of "[[Blue-eyes Ultimate Dragon (FMR)|Blue-eyes Ultimate Dragon]]".

'''Simon Muran''' is the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]'' incarnation of [[Shimon Muran]], a character from the manga and anime. Simon is [[Prince (FMR)|the prince]]'s tutor, attendant and card mentor. He taught the prince how to play the card game.

==Biography==
Depending on the player's actions, Simon can tell the prince the story of how the card games were used to Summon powerful monsters, causing chaos, therefore restricting the use of the cards to their kingdom. Also depending on their actions, they may duel him.

When [[Heishin]] attacked the palace, claiming to have uncovered great power, Simon is alerted. Simon, not fond of Heishin, confronted him, resulting in Simon being badly beaten. When the prince arrived, Heishin demanded to know where the [[Millennium Puzzle (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Puzzle]] was. Simon secretly gave the Puzzle to the prince, telling him to run. Unable to escape, the prince was forced into a Duel with Heishin. After the prince lost, Simon convinced him to shatter the Puzzle.

Simon sealed the prince's soul within the broken Puzzle, leaving him on a mission to collect the power of the [[Millennium Items (Forbidden Memories)|Millennium Items]] before returning to their time. Upon returning to his time, Simon bid the prince good luck and then faded out of existence.

'''Tea Gardner''', unnamed in the game, is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. This is a video game depiction of [[Anzu Mazaki (manga)|Anzu Mazaki]], a character from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]].

Tea works part-time at the card shop, during the ''[[Duel Monsters]]'' World Championship tournament. When the player enters her shop, they are given the options, "save", "build deck", "return to title" and "leave shop".

Tea appears in the present day events of the game, where she takes the same role as the [[card shop owner (FMR)|card shop owner]], from the ancient Egyptian events. However her ancient Egyptian counterpart is [[Teana]].

'''Teana''', known as '''Anzu''' (アンズ ''Anzu'') in the Japanese version, is the Ancient Egyptian counterpart of [[Tea Gardner (FMR)|Tea Gardner]], in the video game ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. She is friends with [[Prince (FMR)|the Prince]], although she is initially unaware of his royal status.

==Biography==
[[File:Teana captured.png|thumb|left|300px|Teana, captured by [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]] and [[Heishin]].]]
Teana first appears in the Dueling Grounds dueling the Prince. She tells him of a festival occurring in the Plaza, and they leave to see it. They watch the mages march around a shrine, holding flags. She comments that the ceremonies are starting to seem darker, assuming that it is the work of the "detestable" high mage [[Heishin]]. She spots [[Jono]] dueling, and greets him just before the mage [[Seto (FMR)|Seto]], defeats him. Seto mocks Jono's dueling skills but Jono and Teana tell him that The Prince could easily defeat him. Seto is however summoned and cannot duel the Prince. Teana, Jono and the Prince return to the Dueling Grounds where she loses to the Prince in a friendly duel.

When Jono leads the Prince to the Hidden Dueling grounds after his return to Ancient Egypt, Teana challenges the Prince to a friendly Duel. She is later kidnapped by Seto but is rescued by The Prince and Jono. She thanks the boys for rescuing her.

==Dialogue==

{{Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories characters}}

{{Infobox character
| image         = Villager3-FMR.png
| unnamed       = true
| gender        = Male
| appears_in_ps = ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''
}}

'''Villager3''' is one of the villagers who goes to the Dueling Grounds in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''.

==Biography==
Villager3 meets the [[Prince (FMR)|prince]] at the Dueling Grounds. Although he is unaware of his royal status.

The prince can only duel him when he first visits the Dueling Grounds, before meeting [[Jono]]. After the fall of the prince, he says he that he does not Duel anymore, and only visits the Dueling Grounds for card trading.

'''Weevil Underwood''', known as '''Insector Haga''' in the Japanese version, is a character in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories]]''. This is a video incarnation of [[Insector Haga (manga)|Insector Haga]] from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (manga)|''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' manga]].

==Biography==
Weevil takes part in the [[KaibaCorp|Kaiba Corporation]] World Championship tournament and faces [[Yugi Muto (FMR)|Yugi Muto]] in the second round.
